summary: This is an email from October 20, 2020, regarding the establishment of a review protocol for image and video files seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices. It outlines the assignment of ten specific devices to an FBI review team and references attached legal documents including a search warrant application and the Maxwell indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email concerns the review of image and video files from his seized electronic devices as part of an ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Her superseding indictment is attached to the email and contains a photograph of her with Epstein.

connections.description: Referenced together in the attached Maxwell indictment, which includes a photograph of both individuals.

events.title: Distribution of Epstein Device Review Protocol
events.description: An email with a review protocol for image and video files from Epstein's devices is sent, outlining procedures and device assignments for the FBI and USAO teams.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a 2020 email coordinating the review of image and video files from ten specific electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein (e.g., NYC024363, NYC024394).
The review protocol required teams to read an attached search warrant application and supporting affidavit, indicating an active investigative process.
The Maxwell superseding indictment was also attached for reviewer reference, directly linking the Epstein and Maxwell investigations.
The email specifies an initial assignment of all ten listed devices to an FBI review team for examination.
The correspondence originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating federal oversight of the evidence review.
